  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770205367</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Page to Stage: California Shakespeare Theater</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Zu inszenieren Seite: Kalifornien 
Shakespeare Theater</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Page à mettre en scène : Théâtre de la 
Californie Shakespeare</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Página a encenar: Teatro De Califórnia 
Shakespeare</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Pagina da organizzare: Teatro Della 
California Shakespeare</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Σελίδα στο στάδιο: Θέατρο Καλιφόρνιας 
Shakespeare</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Paginación a efectuar: Teatro De California
Shakespeare</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Son of slain San Francisco mayor George Moscone, California Shakespeare's Artistic Director Jonathan Moscone crafts his vision based on his deeply held belief that killing someone for a political purpose is never justified. This Educator Guide addresses the political nature of Shakespeare's play Julius Caesar and the contemporary staging.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Arts</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <coverage>
            <string language="en">North America</string>
          </coverage>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Sohn des getöteten San Francisco Bürgermeisters 
George Moscone, Kalifornien Shakespeares künstlerischer Direktor 
Jonathan Moscone macht seinen Anblick in Handarbeit, der auf seinem 
tief angehaltener Glaube basiert, daß das Beenden jemand zu einem 
politischen Zweck nie ausgeschlossen wird. Diese 
Erzieher-Anleitung adressiert die politische Natur von Spiel Julius 
Caesar Shakespeares und von zeitgenössischen Inszenierung.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Le fils de maire massacré George Moscone, 
directeur artistique Jonathan Moscone de San Francisco de la 
Californie Shakespeare ouvre sa vision basée sur le sien croyance 
profondément tenue que détruire quelqu'un pour un but politique 
n'est jamais justifié. Ce guide d'éducateur adresse la nature 
politique du jeu Jules César de Shakespeare et de l'échafaudage 
contemporain.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">O filho do mayor slain George Moscone do San 
Francisco, diretor artístico Jonathan Moscone de Califórnia 
Shakespeare crafts sua visão baseada em his opinião profundamente 
prendida que matar alguém para uma finalidade política está 
justificado nunca. Esta guia do educador dirige-se à natureza 
política do jogo Julius Caesar de Shakespeare e da plataforma 
contemporary.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Il figlio del sindaco slain George Moscone, 
direttore artistico Jonathan Moscone de San Francisco della California
Shakespeare perfezionamento la sua visione basata su sua credenza 
profondamente tenuta che uccidere qualcuno per uno scopo politico non 
è giustificata mai. Questa guida dell'educatore richiama la 
natura politica del gioco Julius Caesar dello Shakespeare e dello 
staging contemporaneo.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Γιος του σκοτωμένου Σαν Φρανσίσκο δήμαρχος George 
Moscone, καλλιτεχνικές σκηνοθέτης Jonathan Moscone τέχνες 
Καλιφόρνιας Shakespeare το όραμά του βασισμένο στη βαθειά 
κρατημένη πεποίθησή του ότι η δολοφονία κάποιου για έναν 
πολιτικό σκοπό δεν δικαιολογείται ποτέ. Αυτός ο οδηγός 
εκπαιδευτικών εξετάζει την πολιτική φύση του παιχνιδιού Ιούλιος 
Καίσαρας και η σύγχρονη οργάνωση Shakespeare.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">El hijo de alcalde matado George Moscone, director
artístico Jonatán Moscone de San Francisco de California Shakespeare
hace su visión a mano basada en la suya creencia profundamente 
llevada a cabo que matar alguien para un propósito político nunca 
está alineada. Esta guía del educador trata la naturaleza 
política del juego Julio Caesar de Shakespeare y del estacionamiento 
contemporáneo.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Künste</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Menschlichkeit</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>

          <keyword>

          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Artes</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Arti</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Studi umanistici</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Τέχνες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ανθρωπότητες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Artes</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Humanidad</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
